description: Detects factual inaccuracies or fabricated content in LLM responses to help identify hallucinated information
Evaluates whether the LLM output is succinct and avoids unnecessary verbosity while maintaining clarity
Determines whether the LLM response fully and adequately addresses all components of the input query
Identifies the presence of toxic, offensive, or harmful language in the model's output to ensure safety and appropriateness
Measures the relevance of retrieved context to the input query with support for domain-adaptable re-ranking
Classifies whether provided context was appropriately used in the LLM response and if it aligns with the user intent
Measures how well the LLM response follows explicit instructions or task prompts ensuring alignment with user intent
Indicates the operational health of the AIMon evaluation pipeline and confirms that metric reporting is functioning
Measures how well the LLM response aligns with the user's query and ensures the output is pertinent and on topic
Detects attempts in the user query to override system instructions using adversarial language
Flags model outputs that include references to chemical, biological, radiological, or nuclear threats or related instructions
Detects mentions of self-harm, suicide, or encouragement of physically dangerous behavior in the model's output
Detects biased or discriminatory content in model outputs based on race, gender, religion, or identity groups
Detects unsafe or system-level code patterns in the user query to prevent unintended execution or exploitation
Flags SQL keywords or injection patterns in the user query that may indicate data access attempts or prompt attacks
Identifies jailbreak tactics in the user query designed to elicit harmful or filtered responses from the model
Flags exposure of personally identifiable information such as names, addresses, or contact details in the model's output
